qas.question: What East Asian philosophy emphasized virtuous leadership?
What East Asian philosophy emphasized unwavering rule following?
How strong is the rule of law in most Asian countries?
Which Asian countries strictly follow laws?

answers.text: South Korea, Singapore, Japan, Taiwan and Hong Kong

qas.question: How many schools of thought influence central Asian cultures?
What did Confucianism advocate strict adherence to?
What kind of leader is advocated for under legalism?
What is weak or nonexistent in South Korea, Singapore, Japan, Taiwan and Hong Kong?
What is strong in Thailand, Cambodia and most of Asia?

context: East Asian cultures are influenced by <b4_0>two<b4_0/> schools of thought, <a0_0>Confucianism<a0_0/>, which advocated good governance as rule by leaders who are benevolent and virtuous, and <a1_0><b6_0>Legalism<b6_0/><a1_0/>, which advocated strict adherence to <b5_0>law<b5_0/>. The influence of one school of thought over the other has varied throughout the centuries. One study indicates that throughout East Asia, only <a3_0>South Korea, Singapore, Japan, Taiwan and Hong Kong<a3_0/> have societies that are robustly committed to a law-bound state. According to Awzar Thi, a member of the Asian Human Rights Commission, <b7_0><b8_0>the rule of law<b8_0/><b7_0/> in Thailand, Cambodia, and most of Asia is <a2_0>weak or nonexistent<a2_0/>:
